welcome: My name is Luke Liukonen, and I am a Senior Software Engineer, educator, and tech enthusiast based out of the Metro Milwaukee Wisconsin area. Let's be honest though, that's only a small sliver of who I am. I've been in development for over 14 years professionally, spending most of my time in the travel space. My main focus is backend development, however, I have transitioned to more of a full stack developer. I have  been fascinated with the direction technology could take us, and was a huge fan of how we would interact with them in the future. To this day, I like to consider myself a technologist, reading up on current trends, and what progress we are making in the field.

highlights.a: 2-time company representative for MMAC 'Be the Spark Tour'
Participant at  Microsoft chat bot Hack-a-thon, 2017
On multiple committees for outreach, wellness, and event planning
Developer lead on team for nearly 6 years
Adjunct Instructor for 2 semesters at ITT Technical Institute
Owasp top 10 trained. Maintained PCI complience
Hackathon: Using AI and AWS to flag fraud transactions.
Hackathon: keyword and sentiment analysis tool for consumer reviews.
Hackathon: Automation of rates and pricing based on competitor and historical pricing.
Hackathon: Natural language platform for conducting transactions.

Work.name: Brady Corporation
Work.title: Senior Software Engineer
Work.summary: Primary focus is on the ecommerce platform. This entails a full stack development platform, including SASS Stylesheets, Javascript and Javasript frameworks, MVC, Sitecore controls, Test Driven Development, and light DevOps. Other items I have focused on includes Docker Containerization of tools, and optimizing and creating one click 'Dev environments as code' setup scripts for onboarding and rebuilding of machines.

Work.name: Trisept Solutions
Work.title: Software Analyst (Mid/Snr Engineer Eq)
Work.summary: For 3 years was the development lead for the product support area of the company. My current role is focused on the backend system (Avail, packaging, booking) engine of the system. This is a Full-stack position. Other tasks I've also taken on include writing setup materials/documentation, consulted in system analysis tasks on system performance and monitoring, and mentored both new developers and junior developers in our system.

Work.name: Blue7 Solutions
Work.title: Software Engineer
Work.summary: Worked with Trisept Solutions as there Development lead for the Product Support team, which involves knowledge of Trisept's entire system, debugging and resolving issues in the code base, and managing Blue 7's company offshore resources in Product Support when needed. I also worked as a consultant for Trisept Solutions in the dynamic packaging engine as a full stack developer.

Work.name: Trisept Solutions
Work.title: Software Developer
Work.summary: Developed on and maintained the companies dynamic packaging engine which bundled vacation packages together based on preset rules, and there booking engine which then booked the vacation packages. Became a knowledge expert on the companies custom backend entry systems. Technologies that interacted with at a given time included, C#, VB.net, SQL, XML, javascript and ASP.net

Work.name: ITT Tech
Work.title: Adjunct Instructor
Work.summary: I taught 2 courses during my time at ITT Tech. The first was Introduction to Programming and the second, Introduction to Computers. These courses helped me develop my managerial approach outlook, as I learned from it that it is best to guide people to the answer, then to just give them the answer. It also honed my skills of admin tasks, time management, and how to manage multiple people at the same time.
